questions.text: What is a 'Digital Twin' in the context of Industry 4.0?
options: A backup copy of a factory's data
A virtual representation of a physical object or system
A robot that looks identical to a human worker
A type of industrial sensor
questions.correctAnswer: A virtual representation of a physical object or system

questions.text: Which of the following is a key benefit of using digital twins?
options: Eliminating the need for physical assets
Simulation, testing, and optimization in a virtual environment
Automatically repairing physical equipment
Providing internet access to factory workers
questions.correctAnswer: Simulation, testing, and optimization in a virtual environment

questions.text: What data is essential for creating and maintaining an effective digital twin?
options: Only the original design schematics
Only data from the manufacturing date
Real-time data from sensors on the physical asset
Only financial data related to the asset
questions.correctAnswer: Real-time data from sensors on the physical asset

questions.text: The connection between a physical asset and its digital twin is typically:
options: One-way, from physical to digital
One-way, from digital to physical
Bi-directional, with data flowing between both
Non-existent after the initial creation
questions.correctAnswer: Bi-directional, with data flowing between both

questions.text: What is a primary use case for a digital twin in the manufacturing sector?
options: Monitoring employee emails
Optimizing production processes and predicting failures
Managing the company's social media accounts
Designing the factory cafeteria menu
questions.correctAnswer: Optimizing production processes and predicting failures

questions.text: Which technology is NOT typically a core component of a digital twin implementation?
options: IoT sensors
Cloud computing
Machine learning
Blockchain

questions.text: How can a digital twin assist with product design?
options: By automatically generating new product ideas
By simulating how a product will perform under various conditions before it's built
By marketing the product to potential customers
By handling the legal patent application
questions.correctAnswer: By simulating how a product will perform under various conditions before it's built

questions.text: What is the difference between a digital model and a digital twin?
options: There is no difference
A digital model is static, while a digital twin is dynamic and updated with real-time data
A digital twin is static, while a digital model is dynamic
A digital model is more complex than a digital twin
questions.correctAnswer: A digital model is static, while a digital twin is dynamic and updated with real-time data

questions.text: A digital twin of an entire city is often referred to as a:
options: Smart City
City Simulator
Urban Twin
Metropolis Model

questions.text: What is a major challenge in implementing digital twins?
options: Finding enough data to model
The complexity and cost of integration and data management
Lack of potential use cases
The technology is too simple
questions.correctAnswer: The complexity and cost of integration and data management
